Dialogue.Page: TRAPPIST-1e is the fourth planet around the star TRAPPIST-1.
TRAPPIST-1e is an Earth-like terrestrial planet orbiting on the outer edge of TRAPPIST-1's habitable zone.
It receives about 60% the light Earth does, putting it on the outer edge of the habitable zone.
Assuming a compact atmosphere, it is warm enough for liquid water to pool on it's surface.
It is one of the best candidates for extraterrestrial life found so far.
TRAPPIST-1e does not have a Venus-like greenhouse atmosphere like many other planets in the TRAPPIST-1 system.
It could have a compact, Earth-like atmosphere, making it a good place for finding life.
Or it may instead have a thin Mars-like atmosphere, or no atmosphere at all.
TRAPPIST-1e is one of two planets in the system assumed to not contain significant amount of water.
That said, it may still have enough water to completely coat it's surface.
Due to the heat of the day side and cold of the night side, liquid water may only be possible along the terminator.
However, the atmosphere may be able to distribute hear across the planet's surface, allowing liquid water anywhere on the surface.
TRAPPIST-1e is one of the best candidates for extraterrestrial life found so far.
It (might) have all the components, Earth-like mass and radius, Earth-like atmosphere and a (relatively) moderate amount of liquid water.
If life does exist on this planet, any plant life could not be green like as depicted due to the dim, reddish light coming from TRAPPIST-1, it would probably be black.
